entries.meaning: A backward regression; a reverting back to a worse state.
(dance) A dance move in which the feet are alternately slid back and the heels lifted, giving the illusion of walking forwards while actually moving backwards.

verbs.description: backslide (third-person singular simple present backslides, present participle backsliding, simple past backslid or backslided, past participle backslidden or backslid or backslided)

entries.meaning: To regress; to slip backwards or revert to a previous, worse state.
examples: He felt better for a little while, before his condition started to backslide.

entries.meaning: To shirk responsibility; to renege on one's obligations or commitments.
(Christianity) To revert back into a life of sin after being saved.
